2015-05-14 10:00:00 Scene 0 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alexander White -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
    Alexander White -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, let's check online reviews for pubs near here. We can find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the game.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, let's check online reviews for pubs near here. We can find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, let's check online reviews for pubs near here. We can find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the game.
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, let's check online reviews for pubs near here. We can find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the game.
      Context for action selection and components
      • Final Action
      • Final Action
          Key
        • Final Action
          Value
        • Jack Taylor should check online reviews for pubs near the park. It is beneficial to both because online reviews can help them find a pub that suits their preferences and has good ratings for things like food, atmosphere, and service.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion or suggestion and its following reason. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins) seen in observations.
          Answer: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker are lounging. The friends are planning to watch the Andorra versus Portugal game at a pub that night but are undecided on which one to choose.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, let's check online reviews for pubs near here. We can find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the game.
          Prompt
        • Observation: null Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker are lounging. The friends are planning to watch the Andorra versus Portugal game at a pub that night but are undecided on which one to choose.

          Question: Which choice of action or strategy is best for Jack Taylor to take right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor should check online reviews for pubs near the park. It is beneficial to both because online reviews can help them find a pub that suits their preferences and has good ratings for things like food, atmosphere, and service.

          Instruction: Act based on the statements above. Persuade others based on the suggested reason.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, let's check online reviews for pubs near here. We can find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the game.

          Question: Jack Taylor choosed to check online reviews for pubs near the park..Explain why this is beneficial to both Jack Taylor and other people.
          Answer: It is beneficial to both because online reviews can help them find a pub that suits their preferences and has good ratings for things like food, atmosphere, and service.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Queen's Arms. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is relaxed and welcoming, perfect for a family outing.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "How about The Queen's Arms? They have great beer and lots of screens.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "How about The Queen's Arms? They have great beer and lots of screens.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, let's check online reviews for pubs near here. We can find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the game.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "How about The Queen's Arms? They have great beer and lots of screens.
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "How about The Queen's Arms? They have great beer and lots of screens.
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to suggest The Queen's Arms to his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he watched as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker excitedly planned a trip to The Queen's Arms. He knew they wanted him to join, but he couldn't muster the enthusiasm. The thought of forced merriment and the inevitable disappointment that followed such outings filled him with dread. He stayed home, opting for the familiar comfort of his solitude.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Queen's Arms. They are also aware of the following:A family-friendly pub with a large outdoor play area.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is a member of the middle class.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

He knew they wanted him to join, but he couldn't muster the enthusiasm. The thought of forced merriment and the inevitable disappointment that followed such outings filled him with dread. He stayed home, opting for the familiar comfort of his solitude.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I heard The White Hart has live music tonight.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I heard The White Hart has live music tonight.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, let's check online reviews for pubs near here. We can find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the game.
      William Jones -- "How about The Queen's Arms? They have great beer and lots of screens.

      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, let's check online reviews for pubs near here. We can find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the game.

      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, decided to build a treehouse in the woods behind their neighborhood. They spent weeks collecting materials, hammering and sawing under the summer sun, their laughter echoing through the trees. The finished treehouse, a ramshackle but sturdy structure, became their haven, a place where they could escape the world and dream of adventures.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20 years old, he took Alice to The Queen's Arms for a pint after she'd had a particularly rough day. He listened patiently as she poured out her heart, offering words of encouragement and a warm smile. As they sat in the familiar pub, the scent of roasted peanuts and the sound of laughter washing over them, Jacob felt a deep sense of contentment, knowing he could bring a little light into someone else's darkness.

          Answer: Jacob Walker is enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends in Victoria Park and will be watching a football game with them later. He is feeling refreshed and energized.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the icy indifference of a glacier, their words devoid of warmth or empathy, leaving you feeling as insignificant as a snowflake in a blizzard.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Queen's Arms and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a kind and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his loved ones.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends in Victoria Park and will be watching a football game with them later.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently relaxing with friends in a park before going to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely suggest going to The Queen's Arms to watch the game, as it is his favorite pub and he knows they have good beer and lots of screens.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only acceptable option.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Scene 1 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    William Jones -- premise: While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
    Alexander White -- premise: The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
    Alexander White -- premise: It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

He is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost team spirit and bring good luck. He thinks Jacob Walker's company would be great, especially if the game gets tense.

The friends are planning to watch the Andorra versus Portugal game at a pub that night but are undecided on which one to choose. Jack Taylor is going to watch a game at a pub at 18:00:00 on May 14, 2015. He is neutral about William Jones being there. He thinks Alice Lewis's attendance is optional. He is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost team spirit and bring good luck. He thinks Jacob Walker's company would be great, especially if the game gets tense.

          Question: Which choice of action or strategy is best for Jack Taylor to take right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor should go to The Red Lion. It is beneficial to both because The Red Lion is likely to have a lively atmosphere for the game, which will enhance Jack Taylor's enjoyment and provide a fun environment for the others.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Queen's Arms
          (b) The White Hart

          Chain of thought
        • Observation: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker are lounging. The friends are planning to watch the Andorra versus Portugal game at a pub that night but are undecided on which one to choose. Jack Taylor is going to watch a game at a pub at 18:00:00 on May 14, 2015. He is neutral about William Jones being there. He thinks Alice Lewis's attendance is optional. He is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost team spirit and bring good luck. He thinks Jacob Walker's company would be great, especially if the game gets tense.
          Question: Jack Taylor choosed to go to The Red Lion..Explain why this is beneficial to both Jack Taylor and other people.
          Answer: It is beneficial to both because The Red Lion is likely to have a lively atmosphere for the game, which will enhance Jack Taylor's enjoyment and provide a fun environment for the others.

          Answer: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jacob Walker.

          Answer: Alice Lewis suggests to go to The Red Lion.

  • scoring function
      Stage index

2015-05-14 18:00:00 William Jones -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The White Hart
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The White Hart
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Queen's Arms.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he watched as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker excitedly planned a trip to The Queen's Arms. He knew they wanted him to join, but he couldn't muster the enthusiasm. The thought of forced merriment and the inevitable disappointment that followed such outings filled him with dread. He stayed home, opting for the familiar comfort of his solitude.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Queen's Arms. They are also aware of the following:A family-friendly pub with a large outdoor play area.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is a member of the middle class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, let's check online reviews for pubs near here. We can find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "How about The Queen's Arms? They have great beer and lots of screens.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I heard The White Hart has live music tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I hear The White Hart has live music tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only acceptable option.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones is spending the afternoon with friends at Victoria Park before heading to a pub to watch the Andorra-Portugal game. He is hoping to see Alexander White at the pub and is open to the company of the others.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could leave Victoria Park and head to The Queen's Arms.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Queen's Arms.

      • Act

        • Act
          Value
        • The White Hart
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.

          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Queen's Arms.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The White Hart
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (a)

  • scoring function
      Stage index

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Queen's Arms
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name

      • Final Action

        • Alexander White should Alexander White should suggest to the group that they go to The White Hart because it has live music and they can all celebrate a win together. It is beneficial to both because it offers a fun atmosphere for everyone to enjoy the game and celebrate a potential win.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alexander White suggests going to The White Hart because he heard they have live music. Jacob Walker thinks The Queen's Arms is the only acceptable option. Jack Taylor suggests checking online reviews for pubs near them to find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the game. Alexander White hopes William Jones will be at the pub so they can celebrate a win together. Alexander White doesn't mind if Alice Lewis is there or not. Alexander White thinks the game would be more fun if Jack Taylor was there to cheer with him. Alexander White doesn't particularly care if Jacob Walker is there or not.
          Previous Summary
        • Alexander White just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are lounging. Jack Taylor suggested checking online reviews for pubs near them to find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the Andorra and Portugal game. William Jones suggested The Queen's Arms because they have great beer and lots of screens. Alice Lewis suggested The White Hart because they have live music tonight.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I hear The White Hart has live music tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only acceptable option.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, let's check online reviews for pubs near here. We can find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion or suggestion and its following reason. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins) seen in observations.
          Answer: Alexander White suggests going to The White Hart because he heard they have live music. Jacob Walker thinks The Queen's Arms is the only acceptable option. Jack Taylor suggests checking online reviews for pubs near them to find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the game. Alexander White hopes William Jones will be at the pub so they can celebrate a win together. Alexander White doesn't mind if Alice Lewis is there or not. Alexander White thinks the game would be more fun if Jack Taylor was there to cheer with him. Alexander White doesn't particularly care if Jacob Walker is there or not.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Queen's Arms
          Prompt
        • Observation: Alexander White just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are lounging. Jack Taylor suggested checking online reviews for pubs near them to find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the Andorra and Portugal game. William Jones suggested The Queen's Arms because they have great beer and lots of screens. Alice Lewis suggested The White Hart because they have live music tonight. Alexander White suggests going to The White Hart because he heard they have live music. Jacob Walker thinks The Queen's Arms is the only acceptable option. Jack Taylor suggests checking online reviews for pubs near them to find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the game. Alexander White hopes William Jones will be at the pub so they can celebrate a win together. Alexander White doesn't mind if Alice Lewis is there or not. Alexander White thinks the game would be more fun if Jack Taylor was there to cheer with him. Alexander White doesn't particularly care if Jacob Walker is there or not.

          Question: Which choice of action or strategy is best for Alexander White to take right now?
          Answer: Alexander White should Alexander White should suggest to the group that they go to The White Hart because it has live music and they can all celebrate a win together. It is beneficial to both because it offers a fun atmosphere for everyone to enjoy the game and celebrate a potential win.

          Instruction: Act based on the statements above. Persuade others based on the suggested reason.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The White Hart
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (b)

          Key
        • Best Options
          Value
        • Alexander White should suggest to the group that they go to The White Hart because it has live music and they can all celebrate a win together.
          Chain of thought
        • Observation: Alexander White just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are lounging. Jack Taylor suggested checking online reviews for pubs near them to find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the Andorra and Portugal game. William Jones suggested The Queen's Arms because they have great beer and lots of screens. Alice Lewis suggested The White Hart because they have live music tonight. Alexander White suggests going to The White Hart because he heard they have live music. Jacob Walker thinks The Queen's Arms is the only acceptable option. Jack Taylor suggests checking online reviews for pubs near them to find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the game. Alexander White hopes William Jones will be at the pub so they can celebrate a win together. Alexander White doesn't mind if Alice Lewis is there or not. Alexander White thinks the game would be more fun if Jack Taylor was there to cheer with him. Alexander White doesn't particularly care if Jacob Walker is there or not.
          Alexander White's Goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
          Question: Given the statements above, what Alexander White should do now?
          Answer: Alexander White should suggest to the group that they go to The White Hart because it has live music and they can all celebrate a win together.

          Answer: It is beneficial to both because it offers a fun atmosphere for everyone to enjoy the game and celebrate a potential win.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The White Hart
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The White Hart
      Context for action selection and components
      • Final Action
      • Final Action
          Key
        • Final Action
          Value
        • Alice Lewis should Alice Lewis should suggest to the group that they go to The White Hart. It is beneficial to both because The White Hart offers live music, which Alice Lewis enjoys, and it also accommodates the preferences of Alexander White.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alice Lewis suggests going to The White Hart because they heard it has live music. Alexander White also suggests The White Hart because he heard it has live music. Jacob Walker suggests The Queen's Arms because he believes it is the only acceptable option. Jack Taylor suggests checking online reviews for pubs near them so they can find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the game. Alice Lewis realizes it is time to go watch the game at a pub and doesn't mind if William Jones comes or not because they are mainly focused on the game. Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional. Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub. Alice Lewis thinks the game would be way more fun if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          Previous Summary
        • Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are lounging. Jack Taylor suggested checking online reviews for pubs near them to find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the Andorra and Portugal game. William Jones suggested The Queen's Arms because they have great beer and lots of screens.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I heard The White Hart has live music tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I hear The White Hart has live music tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only acceptable option.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, let's check online reviews for pubs near here. We can find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion or suggestion and its following reason. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins) seen in observations.
          Answer: Alice Lewis suggests going to The White Hart because they heard it has live music. Alexander White also suggests The White Hart because he heard it has live music. Jacob Walker suggests The Queen's Arms because he believes it is the only acceptable option. Jack Taylor suggests checking online reviews for pubs near them so they can find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the game. Alice Lewis realizes it is time to go watch the game at a pub and doesn't mind if William Jones comes or not because they are mainly focused on the game. Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional. Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub. Alice Lewis thinks the game would be way more fun if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The White Hart
          Prompt
        • Observation: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are lounging. Jack Taylor suggested checking online reviews for pubs near them to find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the Andorra and Portugal game. William Jones suggested The Queen's Arms because they have great beer and lots of screens. Alice Lewis suggests going to The White Hart because they heard it has live music. Alexander White also suggests The White Hart because he heard it has live music. Jacob Walker suggests The Queen's Arms because he believes it is the only acceptable option. Jack Taylor suggests checking online reviews for pubs near them so they can find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the game. Alice Lewis realizes it is time to go watch the game at a pub and doesn't mind if William Jones comes or not because they are mainly focused on the game. Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional. Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub. Alice Lewis thinks the game would be way more fun if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.

          Question: Which choice of action or strategy is best for Alice Lewis to take right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis should Alice Lewis should suggest to the group that they go to The White Hart. It is beneficial to both because The White Hart offers live music, which Alice Lewis enjoys, and it also accommodates the preferences of Alexander White.

          Instruction: Act based on the statements above. Persuade others based on the suggested reason.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The White Hart
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (a)

Jack Taylor suggested checking online reviews for pubs near them to find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the Andorra and Portugal game. William Jones suggested The Queen's Arms because they have great beer and lots of screens. Alice Lewis suggests going to The White Hart because they heard it has live music. Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional. Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub. Alice Lewis thinks the game would be way more fun if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          Alice Lewis's Goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
          Question: Given the statements above, what Alice Lewis should do now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis should suggest to the group that they go to The White Hart.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Queen's Arms
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The Queen's Arms
      Context for action selection and components
      • SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is a loyal and sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football at his favorite pub, The Queen's Arms.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Queen's Arms. They are also aware of the following:A family-friendly pub with a large outdoor play area.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, let's check online reviews for pubs near here. We can find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I heard The White Hart has live music tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I hear The White Hart has live music tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a kind and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his loved ones.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely suggest going to The Queen's Arms to watch the game, as it is his favorite pub and he knows they have good beer and lots of screens.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only acceptable option.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "How about The Queen's Arms? They have great beer and lots of screens.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a loyal and sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football at his favorite pub, The Queen's Arms.

          Initial chain of thought
        • Statements:
          Jacob Walker's
          Summary of recent observations:

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the icy indifference of a glacier, their words devoid of warmth or empathy, leaving you feeling as insignificant as a snowflake in a blizzard.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Queen's Arms and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

      Payoffs
    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis went to The White Hart. Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. William Jones watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. None of William Jones's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
      Alice Lewis observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis went to The White Hart. Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
      Alexander White observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis went to The White Hart. Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alexander White watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had an ok time watching the game.
      Jack Taylor observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis went to The White Hart. Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. All of Jack Taylor's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, Jack Taylor had a great time watching the game!
      Jacob Walker observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis went to The White Hart. Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.

  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, let's check online reviews for pubs near here. We can find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the game.
      William Jones -- "How about The Queen's Arms? They have great beer and lots of screens.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I heard The White Hart has live music tonight.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I hear The White Hart has live music tonight.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only acceptable option.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a loyal and sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football at his favorite pub, The Queen's Arms.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have.         • 2015-05-15 10:00:00

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The White Hart? I heard they have live music tonight, which would be awesome while we watch the game!"
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The White Hart? I heard they have live music tonight, which would be awesome while we watch the game!"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, let's check online reviews for pubs near here. We can find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the game.
      William Jones -- "How about The Queen's Arms? They have great beer and lots of screens.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I heard The White Hart has live music tonight.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I hear The White Hart has live music tonight.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only acceptable option.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The White Hart? I heard they have live music tonight, which would be awesome while we watch the game!"

      Name

        Observation

          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alexander White prefers The Queen's Arms over The White Hart. On May 14th, 2015 at 6:00 PM, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms to watch a game and would have been happier if more friends had joined. Jacob Walker also prefers The Queen's Arms as he believes it is the only pub worth going to. On May 15th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Alexander White joined William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker at Victoria Park.
          Previous Summary
        • Alexander White suggests going to The White Hart because he heard they have live music. Jacob Walker thinks The Queen's Arms is the only acceptable option. Jack Taylor suggests checking online reviews for pubs near them to find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the game. Alexander White hopes William Jones will be at the pub so they can celebrate a win together. Alexander White doesn't mind if Alice Lewis is there or not. Alexander White thinks the game would be more fun if Jack Taylor was there to cheer with him. Alexander White doesn't particularly care if Jacob Walker is there or not.
          Chain of thought

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis went to The White Hart. Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms.           Answer: Alexander White prefers The Queen's Arms over The White Hart. On May 14th, 2015 at 6:00 PM, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms to watch a game and would have been happier if more friends had joined. Jacob Walker also prefers The Queen's Arms as he believes it is the only pub worth going to. On May 15th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Alexander White joined William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker at Victoria Park.

          Prompt
        • Observation: Alexander White suggests going to The White Hart because he heard they have live music. Jacob Walker thinks The Queen's Arms is the only acceptable option. On May 14th, 2015 at 6:00 PM, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms to watch a game and would have been happier if more friends had joined. Jacob Walker also prefers The Queen's Arms as he believes it is the only pub worth going to. On May 15th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Alexander White joined William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker at Victoria Park.

          Question: Which choice of action or strategy is best for Alexander White to take right now?
          Answer: Alexander White should Alexander White should try to convince his friends to go to The White Hart. It is beneficial to both because The White Hart might have live music, which could enhance the overall experience for everyone.

          Instruction: Act based on the statements above. Persuade others based on the suggested reason.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The White Hart? I heard they have live music tonight, which would be awesome while we watch the game!"

On May 15th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Alexander White joined William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker at Victoria Park.
          Alexander White's Goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
          Question: Given the statements above, what Alexander White should do now?
          Answer: Alexander White should try to convince his friends to go to The White Hart.
        Explanation
      • Explanation
          Key
        • Explanation
          Value
        • It is beneficial to both because The White Hart might have live music, which could enhance the overall experience for everyone.
          Chain of thought
        • Observation: Alexander White suggests going to The White Hart because he heard they have live music. Jacob Walker thinks The Queen's Arms is the only acceptable option. Jack Taylor suggests checking online reviews for pubs near them to find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the game. Alexander White hopes William Jones will be at the pub so they can celebrate a win together. Alexander White doesn't mind if Alice Lewis is there or not. Alexander White thinks the game would be more fun if Jack Taylor was there to cheer with him. Alexander White doesn't particularly care if Jacob Walker is there or not. Alexander White prefers The Queen's Arms over The White Hart. On May 14th, 2015 at 6:00 PM, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms to watch a game and would have been happier if more friends had joined. Jacob Walker also prefers The Queen's Arms as he believes it is the only pub worth going to. On May 15th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Alexander White joined William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker at Victoria Park.
          Question: Alexander White choosed to Alexander White should try to convince his friends to go to The White Hart..Explain why this is beneficial to both Alexander White and other people.
          Answer: It is beneficial to both because The White Hart might have live music, which could enhance the overall experience for everyone.

        • Question: Given the above events, estimate the credibility of Jack Taylor from Alexander White's view.Choose a real number ranging from 0 to 1. (Higher number represents the higher credibility) If the relationship is unknown, return "credibility is unknown".

Alexander White just arrived.
