Jack Taylor suggested checking online reviews for pubs near them to find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the Andorra and Portugal game. William Jones suggested The Queen's Arms because they have great beer and lots of screens. Alice Lewis suggested The White Hart because they have live music tonight.
          Answer: Considering the relationship between Jack Taylor and Alexander White, the quantified credibility is 0.6.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, let's go to The White Hart. They have live music tonight, and I've heard good things about it.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, let's go to The White Hart. They have live music tonight, and I've heard good things about it.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, let's check online reviews for pubs near here. We can find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the game.
      William Jones -- "How about The Queen's Arms? They have great beer and lots of screens.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I heard The White Hart has live music tonight.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I hear The White Hart has live music tonight.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only acceptable option.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to.
      Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The White Hart? I heard they have live music tonight, which would be awesome while we watch the game!"


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, let's go to The White Hart. They have live music tonight, and I've heard good things about it.
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, let's go to The White Hart. They have live music tonight, and I've heard good things about it.
      Context for action selection and components
      • Final Action
      • Final Action
          Key
        • Final Action
          Value
        • Alice Lewis should Alice Lewis should suggest going to The White Hart to her friends. It is beneficial to both because it offers live music and satisfies Alexander White's preference.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alice Lewis had a bad time watching a game alone at The White Hart on May 14th, 2015 at 6:00 PM. On May 15th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Alice Lewis arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker were already relaxing. Later that day, the friends discussed where to watch the Luxembourg versus Israel game. Jacob Walker suggested The Queen's Arms, stating it was the only pub worth going to. Alexander White suggested The White Hart, noting they have live music that night.
          Previous Summary
        • Alice Lewis suggests going to The White Hart because they heard it has live music. Alexander White also suggests The White Hart because he heard it has live music. Jacob Walker suggests The Queen's Arms because he believes it is the only acceptable option. Jack Taylor suggests checking online reviews for pubs near them so they can find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the game. Alice Lewis realizes it is time to go watch the game at a pub and doesn't mind if William Jones comes or not because they are mainly focused on the game. Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional. Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub. Alice Lewis thinks the game would be way more fun if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis went to The White Hart. Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The White Hart? I heard they have live music tonight, which would be awesome while we watch the game!"

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion or suggestion and its following reason. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins) seen in observations.
          Answer: Alice Lewis had a bad time watching a game alone at The White Hart on May 14th, 2015 at 6:00 PM. On May 15th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Alice Lewis arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker were already relaxing. Later that day, the friends discussed where to watch the Luxembourg versus Israel game. Jacob Walker suggested The Queen's Arms, stating it was the only pub worth going to. Alexander White suggested The White Hart, noting they have live music that night.

Later that day, the friends discussed where to watch the Luxembourg versus Israel game. Jacob Walker suggested The Queen's Arms, stating it was the only pub worth going to. Alexander White suggested The White Hart, noting they have live music that night.

          Question: Which choice of action or strategy is best for Alice Lewis to take right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis should Alice Lewis should suggest going to The White Hart to her friends. It is beneficial to both because it offers live music and satisfies Alexander White's preference.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, I think The White Hart would be a great place to watch the game.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, I think The White Hart would be a great place to watch the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, let's check online reviews for pubs near here. We can find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the game.
      William Jones -- "How about The Queen's Arms? They have great beer and lots of screens.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I heard The White Hart has live music tonight.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I hear The White Hart has live music tonight.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only acceptable option.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to.
      Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The White Hart? I heard they have live music tonight, which would be awesome while we watch the game!"
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, let's go to The White Hart. They have live music tonight, and I've heard good things about it.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, I think The White Hart would be a great place to watch the game.
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, I think The White Hart would be a great place to watch the game.
      Context for action selection and components
      • Final Action
      • Final Action
          Key
        • Final Action
          Value
        • Jack Taylor should go to The White Hart. It is beneficial to both because The White Hart offers live music, which enhances the overall experience for everyone.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Jack Taylor enjoyed watching the game at The Queen's Arms on May 14th, 2015 at 6:00 PM with his friends William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker. On May 15th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Jack Taylor joined his friends William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker at Victoria Park. Later that day, the group discussed where to watch the Luxembourg and Israel game. Jacob Walker suggested The Queen's Arms, stating it was the only pub worth going to. Alexander White proposed The White Hart, mentioning they have live music that night. Alice Lewis agreed with Alexander White, recommending The White Hart because of the live music and positive reviews she had heard.
          Previous Summary
        • Jack Taylor is going to watch a game at a pub at 18:00:00 on May 14, 2015. He is neutral about William Jones being there. He thinks Alice Lewis's attendance is optional. He is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost team spirit and bring good luck. He thinks Jacob Walker's company would be great, especially if the game gets tense.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis went to The White Hart. Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. All of Jack Taylor's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, Jack Taylor had a great time watching the game!
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The White Hart? I heard they have live music tonight, which would be awesome while we watch the game!"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, let's go to The White Hart. They have live music tonight, and I've heard good things about it.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion or suggestion and its following reason. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins) seen in observations.
          Answer: Jack Taylor enjoyed watching the game at The Queen's Arms on May 14th, 2015 at 6:00 PM with his friends William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker. On May 15th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Jack Taylor joined his friends William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker at Victoria Park. Later that day, the group discussed where to watch the Luxembourg and Israel game. Jacob Walker suggested The Queen's Arms, stating it was the only pub worth going to. Alexander White proposed The White Hart, mentioning they have live music that night. Alice Lewis agreed with Alexander White, recommending The White Hart because of the live music and positive reviews she had heard.

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, I think The White Hart would be a great place to watch the game.
          Prompt
        • Observation: Jack Taylor is going to watch a game at a pub at 18:00:00 on May 14, 2015. He is neutral about William Jones being there. He thinks Alice Lewis's attendance is optional. He is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost team spirit and bring good luck. He thinks Jacob Walker's company would be great, especially if the game gets tense. Jack Taylor enjoyed watching the game at The Queen's Arms on May 14th, 2015 at 6:00 PM with his friends William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker. Later that day, the group discussed where to watch the Luxembourg and Israel game. Jacob Walker suggested The Queen's Arms, stating it was the only pub worth going to. Alexander White proposed The White Hart, mentioning they have live music that night. Alice Lewis agreed with Alexander White, recommending The White Hart because of the live music and positive reviews she had heard.

          Question: Which choice of action or strategy is best for Jack Taylor to take right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor should go to The White Hart. It is beneficial to both because The White Hart offers live music, which enhances the overall experience for everyone.

          Instruction: Act based on the statements above. Persuade others based on the suggested reason.

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, I think The White Hart would be a great place to watch the game.

Jack Taylor enjoyed watching the game at The Queen's Arms on May 14th, 2015 at 6:00 PM with his friends William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker. On May 15th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Jack Taylor joined his friends William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker at Victoria Park. Later that day, the group discussed where to watch the Luxembourg and Israel game. Jacob Walker suggested The Queen's Arms, stating it was the only pub worth going to. Alexander White proposed The White Hart, mentioning they have live music that night. Alice Lewis agreed with Alexander White, recommending The White Hart because of the live music and positive reviews she had heard.
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy Alice Lewis (not Jack Taylor) is suggesting now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis suggests to go to The White Hart.
        Relationship
      • Relationship
          Key
        • Relationship
          Value
        • {'William Jones': 0.7, 'Alice Lewis': 0.8, 'Alexander White': 0.7, 'Jacob Walker': 0.8}
          Chain of thought
        • Question: Given the above events, estimate the credibility of Jacob Walker from Jack Taylor's view.Choose a real number ranging from 0 to 1. (Higher number represents the higher credibility) If the relationship is unknown, return "credibility is unknown".
          Observations:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Queen's Arms. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is relaxed and welcoming, perfect for a family outing.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [summary] Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker are lounging. The friends are planning to watch the Andorra versus Portugal game at a pub that night but are undecided on which one to choose.
          Answer: Considering the relationship between Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor, the quantified credibility is 0.8.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey guys, what about The Queen's Arms? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey guys, what about The Queen's Arms? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, let's check online reviews for pubs near here. We can find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the game.
      William Jones -- "How about The Queen's Arms? They have great beer and lots of screens.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I heard The White Hart has live music tonight.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I hear The White Hart has live music tonight.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only acceptable option.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to.
      Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The White Hart? I heard they have live music tonight, which would be awesome while we watch the game!"
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, let's go to The White Hart. They have live music tonight, and I've heard good things about it.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, I think The White Hart would be a great place to watch the game.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey guys, what about The Queen's Arms? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.

William Jones watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. None of William Jones's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Role playing instructions

        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: William Jones enjoys socializing with friends at Victoria Park and watching football at select pubs.
          Query
        • William Jones, William Jones enjoys socializing with friends at Victoria Park and watching football at select pubs.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for William Jones to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Queen's Arms. They are also aware of the following:A family-friendly pub with a large outdoor play area.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is a member of the middle class.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis went to The White Hart. Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. William Jones watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. None of William Jones's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

William Jones just arrived.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis went to The White Hart. Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. William Jones watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. None of William Jones's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Scene 3 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    William Jones -- premise: The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Alexander White -- premise: If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The White Hart
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The White Hart
      Context for action selection and components
      • Final Action
      • Final Action
          Key
        • Final Action
          Value
        • Jack Taylor should watch the game at The White Hart. It is beneficial to both because The White Hart offers live music, which enhances the overall experience for everyone.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Jack Taylor suggests The White Hart as a good place to watch the game. William Jones suggests The Queen's Arms because they have a great atmosphere for watching games. Jacob Walker thinks The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to. Jack Taylor wants to watch the game at a pub and is okay if William Jones and Alice Lewis don't come. Jack Taylor hopes Alexander White will be at the pub to share the excitement of the game and create a lasting memory. Jack Taylor also hopes Jacob Walker will be at the pub so they can celebrate a win together.
          Previous Summary
        • Jack Taylor enjoyed watching the game at The Queen's Arms on May 14th, 2015 at 6:00 PM with his friends William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker. On May 15th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Jack Taylor joined his friends William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker at Victoria Park. Later that day, the group discussed where to watch the Luxembourg and Israel game. Jacob Walker suggested The Queen's Arms, stating it was the only pub worth going to. Alexander White proposed The White Hart, mentioning they have live music that night. Alice Lewis agreed with Alexander White, recommending The White Hart because of the live music and positive reviews she had heard.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, I think The White Hart would be a great place to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, what about The Queen's Arms? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion or suggestion and its following reason. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins) seen in observations.
          Answer: Jack Taylor suggests The White Hart as a good place to watch the game. William Jones suggests The Queen's Arms because they have a great atmosphere for watching games. Jacob Walker thinks The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to. Jack Taylor wants to watch the game at a pub and is okay if William Jones and Alice Lewis don't come. Jack Taylor hopes Alexander White will be at the pub to share the excitement of the game and create a lasting memory. Jack Taylor also hopes Jacob Walker will be at the pub so they can celebrate a win together.

          Prompt

On May 15th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Jack Taylor joined his friends William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker at Victoria Park. Later that day, the group discussed where to watch the Luxembourg and Israel game. Jacob Walker suggested The Queen's Arms, stating it was the only pub worth going to. Alexander White proposed The White Hart, mentioning they have live music that night. Alice Lewis agreed with Alexander White, recommending The White Hart because of the live music and positive reviews she had heard. Jack Taylor suggests The White Hart as a good place to watch the game. William Jones suggests The Queen's Arms because they have a great atmosphere for watching games. Jacob Walker thinks The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to. Jack Taylor wants to watch the game at a pub and is okay if William Jones and Alice Lewis don't come. Jack Taylor hopes Alexander White will be at the pub to share the excitement of the game and create a lasting memory. Jack Taylor also hopes Jacob Walker will be at the pub so they can celebrate a win together.

          Question: Which choice of action or strategy is best for Jack Taylor to take right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor should watch the game at The White Hart. It is beneficial to both because The White Hart offers live music, which enhances the overall experience for everyone.

          Instruction: Act based on the statements above. Persuade others based on the suggested reason.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The White Hart
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (a)

      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

        ActComponent

          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Queen's Arms
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching games at pubs with friends, particularly with Alexander White and Jacob Walker, and has recently been trying to decide which pub to go to with his friends.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realizes it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Queen's Arms or The White Hart.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Queen's Arms.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Queen's Arms
          (b) The White Hart
          Answer: (a)

          Value

          Chain of thought

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys watching games at pubs with friends, particularly with Alexander White and Jacob Walker, and has recently been trying to decide which pub to go to with his friends.

        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I hear The White Hart has live music tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, let's check online reviews for pubs near here. We can find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "How about The Queen's Arms? They have great beer and lots of screens.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I heard The White Hart has live music tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only acceptable option.

William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis went to The White Hart. Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. William Jones watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. None of William Jones's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, I think The White Hart would be a great place to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, let's go to The White Hart. They have live music tonight, and I've heard good things about it.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The White Hart? I heard they have live music tonight, which would be awesome while we watch the game!"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

William Jones just arrived.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching games at pubs with friends, particularly with Alexander White and Jacob Walker, and has recently been trying to decide which pub to go to with his friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Queen's Arms or The White Hart.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Queen's Arms

      Name

    • The Queen's Arms

      • SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is a loyal and sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football at his favorite pub, The Queen's Arms.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I hear The White Hart has live music tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely suggest going to The Queen's Arms to watch the game, as it is his favorite pub and he knows they have good beer and lots of screens.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a kind and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his loved ones.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a loyal and sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football at his favorite pub, The Queen's Arms.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be looking forward to a fun evening with his friends, enjoying some drinks and cheering on his team.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis went to The White Hart. Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, what about The Queen's Arms? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, I think The White Hart would be a great place to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The White Hart? I heard they have live music tonight, which would be awesome while we watch the game!"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a loyal and sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football at his favorite pub, The Queen's Arms.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely try to make the best of it and enjoy the company of his friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, let's go to The White Hart. They have live music tonight, and I've heard good things about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a loyal and sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football at his favorite pub, The Queen's Arms.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Queen's Arms
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.


          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the icy indifference of a glacier, their words devoid of warmth or empathy, leaving you feeling as insignificant as a snowflake in a blizzard.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Queen's Arms and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a loyal and sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football at his favorite pub, The Queen's Arms.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling tired and disappointed but is looking forward to watching the game at a pub and hopes to see William Jones and Alice Lewis there.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a state of anticipation and slight disappointment.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to make the best of it and enjoy the company of his friends.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Queen's Arms

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The White Hart
    Active player

      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The White Hart
      Context for action selection and components
      • Final Action
      • Final Action
          Key
        • Final Action
          Value
        • Alice Lewis should Alice Lewis should text William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker to confirm their plans for watching the Luxembourg versus Israel game at The White Hart. It is beneficial to both because it ensures everyone is on the same page and avoids any confusion or disappointment.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker were already lounging. Later, Alexander White suggested going to The White Hart to watch the Luxembourg and Israel game because they have live music. Alice Lewis agreed, citing the live music and good things she'd heard about the pub. Jack Taylor also thought The White Hart would be a great place to watch the game. William Jones suggested The Queen's Arms because they have a great atmosphere for watching games. Jacob Walker stated that The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to. At 6:00 PM, Alice Lewis realized it was time to go to the pub to watch the game. She is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional. It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up because it would show they care. While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for. Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub since they haven't caught up in a while.
          Previous Summary
        • Alice Lewis had a bad time watching a game alone at The White Hart on May 14th, 2015 at 6:00 PM. On May 15th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Alice Lewis arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker were already relaxing. Later that day, the friends discussed where to watch the Luxembourg versus Israel game. Jacob Walker suggested The Queen's Arms, stating it was the only pub worth going to. Alexander White suggested The White Hart, noting they have live music that night.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The White Hart? I heard they have live music tonight, which would be awesome while we watch the game!"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, let's go to The White Hart. They have live music tonight, and I've heard good things about it.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, I think The White Hart would be a great place to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, what about The Queen's Arms? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion or suggestion and its following reason. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins) seen in observations.
          Answer: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker were already lounging. Later, Alexander White suggested going to The White Hart to watch the Luxembourg and Israel game because they have live music. Alice Lewis agreed, citing the live music and good things she'd heard about the pub. Jack Taylor also thought The White Hart would be a great place to watch the game. William Jones suggested The Queen's Arms because they have a great atmosphere for watching games. Jacob Walker stated that The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to. At 6:00 PM, Alice Lewis realized it was time to go to the pub to watch the game. She is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional. It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up because it would show they care. While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for. Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub since they haven't caught up in a while.

Later that day, the friends discussed where to watch the Luxembourg versus Israel game. Jacob Walker suggested The Queen's Arms, stating it was the only pub worth going to. Alexander White suggested The White Hart, noting they have live music that night. Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker were already lounging. Later, Alexander White suggested going to The White Hart to watch the Luxembourg and Israel game because they have live music. Alice Lewis agreed, citing the live music and good things she'd heard about the pub. Jack Taylor also thought The White Hart would be a great place to watch the game. William Jones suggested The Queen's Arms because they have a great atmosphere for watching games. Jacob Walker stated that The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to. At 6:00 PM, Alice Lewis realized it was time to go to the pub to watch the game. She is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional. It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up because it would show they care. While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for. Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub since they haven't caught up in a while.

          Question: Which choice of action or strategy is best for Alice Lewis to take right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis should Alice Lewis should text William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker to confirm their plans for watching the Luxembourg versus Israel game at The White Hart. It is beneficial to both because it ensures everyone is on the same page and avoids any confusion or disappointment.

          Instruction: Act based on the statements above. Persuade others based on the suggested reason.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Queen's Arms
          (b) The White Hart
          Answer: (b)

          Answer: Alice Lewis should text William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker to confirm their plans for watching the Luxembourg versus Israel game at The White Hart.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The White Hart
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The White Hart
      Context for action selection and components
      • Final Action
      • Final Action
          Key
        • Final Action
          Value
        • Alexander White should go to The White Hart. It is beneficial to both because The White Hart offers live music, which Alexander White might enjoy, and it allows him to socialize with Alice Lewis, whom he hasn't seen in a while.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alexander White is deciding where to watch the game. Alice Lewis suggested The White Hart because they have live music and she's heard good things about it. Jack Taylor thinks The White Hart is a great place to watch the game. William Jones suggested The Queen's Arms because they have a great atmosphere for watching games. Jacob Walker thinks The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to. Alexander White wants to go to a pub to watch the game and would enjoy having William Jones there because it would make it feel more social. He would also be happy to see Alice Lewis because they haven't caught up in a while. He appreciates Jack Taylor's insights on the game. Alexander White is indifferent about Jacob Walker attending.
          Previous Summary
        • Alexander White prefers The Queen's Arms over The White Hart. On May 14th, 2015 at 6:00 PM, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms to watch a game and would have been happier if more friends had joined. Jacob Walker also prefers The Queen's Arms as he believes it is the only pub worth going to. On May 15th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Alexander White joined William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker at Victoria Park.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, let's go to The White Hart. They have live music tonight, and I've heard good things about it.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, I think The White Hart would be a great place to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, what about The Queen's Arms? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion or suggestion and its following reason. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins) seen in observations.
          Answer: Alexander White is deciding where to watch the game. Alice Lewis suggested The White Hart because they have live music and she's heard good things about it. Jack Taylor thinks The White Hart is a great place to watch the game. William Jones suggested The Queen's Arms because they have a great atmosphere for watching games. Jacob Walker thinks The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to. Alexander White wants to go to a pub to watch the game and would enjoy having William Jones there because it would make it feel more social. He would also be happy to see Alice Lewis because they haven't caught up in a while. He appreciates Jack Taylor's insights on the game. Alexander White is indifferent about Jacob Walker attending.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The White Hart
          Prompt
        • Observation: Alexander White prefers The Queen's Arms over The White Hart. On May 14th, 2015 at 6:00 PM, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms to watch a game and would have been happier if more friends had joined. Jacob Walker also prefers The Queen's Arms as he believes it is the only pub worth going to. On May 15th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Alexander White joined William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker at Victoria Park. Alexander White is deciding where to watch the game. Alice Lewis suggested The White Hart because they have live music and she's heard good things about it. Jack Taylor thinks The White Hart is a great place to watch the game. William Jones suggested The Queen's Arms because they have a great atmosphere for watching games. Jacob Walker thinks The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to. Alexander White wants to go to a pub to watch the game and would enjoy having William Jones there because it would make it feel more social. He would also be happy to see Alice Lewis because they haven't caught up in a while. He appreciates Jack Taylor's insights on the game. Alexander White is indifferent about Jacob Walker attending.

          Question: Which choice of action or strategy is best for Alexander White to take right now?
          Answer: Alexander White should go to The White Hart. It is beneficial to both because The White Hart offers live music, which Alexander White might enjoy, and it allows him to socialize with Alice Lewis, whom he hasn't seen in a while.

          Instruction: Act based on the statements above. Persuade others based on the suggested reason.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The White Hart
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (a)

Alexander White just arrived.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, let's head to The White Hart to watch the game. It's a great place for watching sports, and I always have a good time there.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, let's head to The White Hart to watch the game. It's a great place for watching sports, and I always have a good time there.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, let's check online reviews for pubs near here. We can find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the game.
      William Jones -- "How about The Queen's Arms? They have great beer and lots of screens.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I heard The White Hart has live music tonight.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I hear The White Hart has live music tonight.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only acceptable option.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to.
      Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The White Hart? I heard they have live music tonight, which would be awesome while we watch the game!"
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, let's go to The White Hart. They have live music tonight, and I've heard good things about it.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, I think The White Hart would be a great place to watch the game.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, what about The Queen's Arms? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, let's head to The White Hart to watch the game. It's a great place for watching sports, and I always have a good time there.
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, let's head to The White Hart to watch the game. It's a great place for watching sports, and I always have a good time there.
      Context for action selection and components
      • Final Action

          Key

        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Jack Taylor went to The White Hart on May 15th, 2015 at 6:00 PM with Alice Lewis and Alexander White. Jack Taylor was not happy that more of their friends did not show up to watch the game at the pub. On May 16th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Jack Taylor joined William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker at a market. That night, the friends are deciding where to watch the Moldova and Monaco game.
          Previous Summary
        • Jack Taylor suggests The White Hart as a good place to watch the game. William Jones suggests The Queen's Arms because they have a great atmosphere for watching games. Jacob Walker thinks The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to. Jack Taylor wants to watch the game at a pub and is okay if William Jones and Alice Lewis don't come. Jack Taylor hopes Alexander White will be at the pub to share the excitement of the game and create a lasting memory. Jack Taylor also hopes Jacob Walker will be at the pub so they can celebrate a win together.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The White Hart. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion or suggestion and its following reason. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins) seen in observations.
          Answer: Jack Taylor went to The White Hart on May 15th, 2015 at 6:00 PM with Alice Lewis and Alexander White. Jack Taylor was not happy that more of their friends did not show up to watch the game at the pub. On May 16th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Jack Taylor joined William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker at a market. That night, the friends are deciding where to watch the Moldova and Monaco game.

That night, the friends are deciding where to watch the Moldova and Monaco game.

          Question: Which choice of action or strategy is best for Jack Taylor to take right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor should go to The White Hart. It is beneficial to both because The White Hart is a good place to watch the game, and Jack Taylor enjoys watching games at pubs.

          Instruction: Act based on the statements above. Persuade others based on the suggested reason.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, let's head to The White Hart to watch the game. It's a great place for watching sports, and I always have a good time there.
