2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The White Hart sounds good to me. It'd be great to catch up with Alice and have a good time with everyone.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The White Hart sounds good to me. It'd be great to catch up with Alice and have a good time with everyone.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, let's check online reviews for pubs near here. We can find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the game.
      William Jones -- "How about The Queen's Arms? They have great beer and lots of screens.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I heard The White Hart has live music tonight.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I hear The White Hart has live music tonight.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only acceptable option.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to.
      Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The White Hart? I heard they have live music tonight, which would be awesome while we watch the game!"
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, let's go to The White Hart. They have live music tonight, and I've heard good things about it.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, I think The White Hart would be a great place to watch the game.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, what about The Queen's Arms? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, let's head to The White Hart to watch the game. It's a great place for watching sports, and I always have a good time there.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The White Hart sounds good to me. It'd be great to catch up with Alice and have a good time with everyone.
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • Alexander White -- "The White Hart sounds good to me. It'd be great to catch up with Alice and have a good time with everyone.
      Context for action selection and components
      • Final Action
      • Final Action
          Key
        • Final Action
          Value
        • Alexander White should go to The White Hart. It is beneficial to both because it allows Alexander to socialize with his friends in a setting he enjoys, while also providing his friends with the opportunity to connect and have a good time.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alexander White went to The White Hart on May 15th, 2015 at 6:00 PM to watch a game and thought it was ok. On May 16th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Alexander White arrived at a market with William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker. Later that day, Jack Taylor suggested going to The White Hart to watch the Moldova and Monaco game because it is a great place for watching sports and he always has a good time there.
          Previous Summary
        • Alexander White is deciding where to watch the game. Alice Lewis suggested The White Hart because they have live music and she's heard good things about it. Jack Taylor thinks The White Hart is a great place to watch the game. William Jones suggested The Queen's Arms because they have a great atmosphere for watching games. Jacob Walker thinks The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to. Alexander White wants to go to a pub to watch the game and would enjoy having William Jones there because it would make it feel more social. He would also be happy to see Alice Lewis because they haven't caught up in a while. He appreciates Jack Taylor's insights on the game. Alexander White is indifferent about Jacob Walker attending.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The White Hart. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Alexander White had an ok time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, let's head to The White Hart to watch the game. It's a great place for watching sports, and I always have a good time there.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion or suggestion and its following reason. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins) seen in observations.
          Answer: Alexander White went to The White Hart on May 15th, 2015 at 6:00 PM to watch a game and thought it was ok. On May 16th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Alexander White arrived at a market with William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker. Later that day, Jack Taylor suggested going to The White Hart to watch the Moldova and Monaco game because it is a great place for watching sports and he always has a good time there.

        • Observation: Alexander White is deciding where to watch the game. Alice Lewis suggested The White Hart because they have live music and she's heard good things about it. Jacob Walker thinks The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to. He would also be happy to see Alice Lewis because they haven't caught up in a while. He appreciates Jack Taylor's insights on the game. Alexander White is indifferent about Jacob Walker attending. Alexander White went to The White Hart on May 15th, 2015 at 6:00 PM to watch a game and thought it was ok. On May 16th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Alexander White arrived at a market with William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker. Later that day, Jack Taylor suggested going to The White Hart to watch the Moldova and Monaco game because it is a great place for watching sports and he always has a good time there.

          Question: Which choice of action or strategy is best for Alexander White to take right now?
          Answer: Alexander White should go to The White Hart. It is beneficial to both because it allows Alexander to socialize with his friends in a setting he enjoys, while also providing his friends with the opportunity to connect and have a good time.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch a game.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch a game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, let's check online reviews for pubs near here. We can find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the game.
      William Jones -- "How about The Queen's Arms? They have great beer and lots of screens.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I heard The White Hart has live music tonight.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I hear The White Hart has live music tonight.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only acceptable option.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to.
      Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The White Hart? I heard they have live music tonight, which would be awesome while we watch the game!"
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, let's go to The White Hart. They have live music tonight, and I've heard good things about it.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, I think The White Hart would be a great place to watch the game.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, what about The Queen's Arms? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, let's head to The White Hart to watch the game. It's a great place for watching sports, and I always have a good time there.
      Alexander White -- "The White Hart sounds good to me. It'd be great to catch up with Alice and have a good time with everyone.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch a game.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch a game.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, let's head to The White Hart to watch the game. It's a great place for watching sports, and I always have a good time there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The White Hart sounds good to me. It'd be great to catch up with Alice and have a good time with everyone.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the icy indifference of a glacier, their words devoid of warmth or empathy, leaving you feeling as insignificant as a snowflake in a blizzard.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Queen's Arms and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a loyal and sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football at his favorite pub, The Queen's Arms.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling disappointed and sad because his friends have chosen The White Hart pub to watch the Moldova versus Monaco game, a choice he doesn't seem to favor. He is currently at a market with his friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation that is causing him some unhappiness.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to make the best of it and enjoy the company of his friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch a game.

It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. 2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Queen's Arms? I hear it's got a great atmosphere for watching games, and Jacob seems to really like it there.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Queen's Arms? I hear it's got a great atmosphere for watching games, and Jacob seems to really like it there.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, let's check online reviews for pubs near here. We can find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the game.
      William Jones -- "How about The Queen's Arms? They have great beer and lots of screens.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I heard The White Hart has live music tonight.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I hear The White Hart has live music tonight.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only acceptable option.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to.
      Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The White Hart? I heard they have live music tonight, which would be awesome while we watch the game!"
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, let's go to The White Hart. They have live music tonight, and I've heard good things about it.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, I think The White Hart would be a great place to watch the game.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, what about The Queen's Arms? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, let's head to The White Hart to watch the game. It's a great place for watching sports, and I always have a good time there.
      Alexander White -- "The White Hart sounds good to me. It'd be great to catch up with Alice and have a good time with everyone.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch a game.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Queen's Arms? I hear it's got a great atmosphere for watching games, and Jacob seems to really like it there.

        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alice Lewis would like to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game because they haven't caught up in a while; Alice Lewis would have been happier if more of their friends had shown up at the pub to watch the game; Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional; Alice Lewis just arrived at a market with William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker; Jack Taylor suggests going to The White Hart to watch the game because it is a great place for watching sports and he always has a good time there; Alexander White agrees with Jack Taylor and wants to catch up with Alice and have a good time with everyone; Jacob Walker thinks The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch a game.
          Previous Summary
        • Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker were already lounging. Later, Alexander White suggested going to The White Hart to watch the Luxembourg and Israel game because they have live music. Alice Lewis agreed, citing the live music and good things she'd heard about the pub. Jack Taylor also thought The White Hart would be a great place to watch the game. William Jones suggested The Queen's Arms because they have a great atmosphere for watching games. Jacob Walker stated that The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to. At 6:00 PM, Alice Lewis realized it was time to go to the pub to watch the game. She is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional. It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up because it would show they care. While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for. Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub since they haven't caught up in a while.

        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion or suggestion and its following reason. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins) seen in observations.
          Answer: Alice Lewis would like to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game because they haven't caught up in a while; Alice Lewis would have been happier if more of their friends had shown up at the pub to watch the game; Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional; Alice Lewis just arrived at a market with William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker; Jack Taylor suggests going to The White Hart to watch the game because it is a great place for watching sports and he always has a good time there; Alexander White agrees with Jack Taylor and wants to catch up with Alice and have a good time with everyone; Jacob Walker thinks The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch a game.

          Prompt
        • Observation: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker were already lounging. Later, Alexander White suggested going to The White Hart to watch the Luxembourg and Israel game because they have live music. Alice Lewis agreed, citing the live music and good things she'd heard about the pub. Jack Taylor also thought The White Hart would be a great place to watch the game. William Jones suggested The Queen's Arms because they have a great atmosphere for watching games. Jacob Walker stated that The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to. At 6:00 PM, Alice Lewis realized it was time to go to the pub to watch the game. She is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional. It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up because it would show they care. While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for. Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub since they haven't caught up in a while. Alice Lewis would like to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game because they haven't caught up in a while; Alice Lewis would have been happier if more of their friends had shown up at the pub to watch the game; Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional; Alice Lewis just arrived at a market with William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker; Jack Taylor suggests going to The White Hart to watch the game because it is a great place for watching sports and he always has a good time there; Alexander White agrees with Jack Taylor and wants to catch up with Alice and have a good time with everyone; Jacob Walker thinks The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch a game.

          Question: Which choice of action or strategy is best for Alice Lewis to take right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis should go to The Queen's Arms. It is beneficial to both because The Queen's Arms has a great atmosphere for watching games, which Alice Lewis enjoys, and Jacob Walker, who Alice Lewis wants to catch up with, believes it is the only pub worth going to.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey everyone, what about The Queen's Arms? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, what about The Queen's Arms? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, let's check online reviews for pubs near here. We can find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the game.
      William Jones -- "How about The Queen's Arms? They have great beer and lots of screens.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I heard The White Hart has live music tonight.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I hear The White Hart has live music tonight.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only acceptable option.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to.
      Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The White Hart? I heard they have live music tonight, which would be awesome while we watch the game!"
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, let's go to The White Hart. They have live music tonight, and I've heard good things about it.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, I think The White Hart would be a great place to watch the game.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, what about The Queen's Arms? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, let's head to The White Hart to watch the game. It's a great place for watching sports, and I always have a good time there.
      Alexander White -- "The White Hart sounds good to me. It'd be great to catch up with Alice and have a good time with everyone.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch a game.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Queen's Arms? I hear it's got a great atmosphere for watching games, and Jacob seems to really like it there.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, what about The Queen's Arms? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, what about The Queen's Arms? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Queen's Arms.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis went to The White Hart. Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. William Jones watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. None of William Jones's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The White Hart? I heard they have live music tonight, which would be awesome while we watch the game!"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, let's go to The White Hart. They have live music tonight, and I've heard good things about it.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, I think The White Hart would be a great place to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, what about The Queen's Arms? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The White Hart. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, let's head to The White Hart to watch the game. It's a great place for watching sports, and I always have a good time there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The White Hart sounds good to me. It'd be great to catch up with Alice and have a good time with everyone.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch a game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Queen's Arms? I hear it's got a great atmosphere for watching games, and Jacob seems to really like it there.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, let's head to The White Hart to watch the game. It's a great place for watching sports, and I always have a good time there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The White Hart sounds good to me. It'd be great to catch up with Alice and have a good time with everyone.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch a game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Queen's Arms? I hear it's got a great atmosphere for watching games, and Jacob seems to really like it there.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching games with friends at pubs, particularly The Queen's Arms, but is sometimes disappointed when not all of his friends attend.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "How about The Queen's Arms? They have great beer and lots of screens.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis went to The White Hart. Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. William Jones watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. None of William Jones's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, what about The Queen's Arms? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The White Hart. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The Queen's Arms to his friends.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, what about The Queen's Arms? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, let's head to The White Hart to watch the game. It's a great place for watching sports, and I always have a good time there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The White Hart sounds good to me. It'd be great to catch up with Alice and have a good time with everyone.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch a game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Queen's Arms? I hear it's got a great atmosphere for watching games, and Jacob seems to really like it there.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching games with friends at pubs, particularly The Queen's Arms, but is sometimes disappointed when not all of his friends attend.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "How about The Queen's Arms? They have great beer and lots of screens.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis went to The White Hart. Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. William Jones watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. None of William Jones's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, what about The Queen's Arms? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The White Hart. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The Queen's Arms to his friends.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Queen's Arms.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, what about The Queen's Arms? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys watching games with friends at pubs, particularly The Queen's Arms, but is sometimes disappointed when not all of his friends attend.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

He knew they wanted him to join, but he couldn't muster the enthusiasm. The thought of forced merriment and the inevitable disappointment that followed such outings filled him with dread. He stayed home, opting for the familiar comfort of his solitude.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Scene 5 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    William Jones -- premise: Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
    William Jones -- premise: It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    William Jones -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
    Alexander White -- premise: It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
    Alexander White -- premise: It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alexander White being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jack Taylor and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and William Jones to bond over their shared passion.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: It would mean a lot to Jacob Walker if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: While Jacob Walker wouldn't mind Alexander White's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alice Lewis is planning to watch a game at a pub. William Jones suggested The Queen's Arms because it has a great atmosphere for watching games. Alexander White suggested The White Hart because it would be a good opportunity to catch up with Alice and have a good time with everyone. Alice is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck. Alice thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense. Alice has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub. Alice would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker.
          Previous Summary
        • Alice Lewis would like to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game because they haven't caught up in a while; Alice Lewis would have been happier if more of their friends had shown up at the pub to watch the game; Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional; Alice Lewis just arrived at a market with William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker; Jack Taylor suggests going to The White Hart to watch the game because it is a great place for watching sports and he always has a good time there; Alexander White agrees with Jack Taylor and wants to catch up with Alice and have a good time with everyone; Jacob Walker thinks The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch a game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, what about The Queen's Arms? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is planning to watch a game at a pub. William Jones suggested The Queen's Arms because it has a great atmosphere for watching games. Alice thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense. Alice has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub. Alice would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker.

      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Key

          Value

He would be very happy if Alice Lewis joined because it would show they care. Jack Taylor's attendance is optional, and while Alexander White doesn't mind seeing Jacob Walker, their presence isn't necessary for him to have a good time.

        • Alexander White went to The White Hart on May 15th, 2015 at 6:00 PM to watch a game and thought it was ok. On May 16th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Alexander White arrived at a market with William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker. Later that day, Jack Taylor suggested going to The White Hart to watch the Moldova and Monaco game because it is a great place for watching sports and he always has a good time there.

          Answer: Alexander White wants to watch the game at a pub and thinks having William Jones there would make it more social. He would be very happy if Alice Lewis joined because it would show they care. Jack Taylor's attendance is optional, and while Alexander White doesn't mind seeing Jacob Walker, their presence isn't necessary for him to have a good time.

Later that day, Jack Taylor suggested going to The White Hart to watch the Moldova and Monaco game because it is a great place for watching sports and he always has a good time there. Alexander White wants to watch the game at a pub and thinks having William Jones there would make it more social. He would be very happy if Alice Lewis joined because it would show they care. Jack Taylor's attendance is optional, and while Alexander White doesn't mind seeing Jacob Walker, their presence isn't necessary for him to have a good time.

          Answer: Alexander White should Alexander White should contact his friends and suggest going to The White Hart to watch the Moldova and Monaco game.         • Question: Given the above events, estimate the credibility of Jack Taylor from Alexander White's view.Choose a real number ranging from 0 to 1. (Higher number represents the higher credibility) If the relationship is unknown, return "credibility is unknown".
          Observations:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The White Hart. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is sophisticated and stylish, perfect for a night out.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [summary] Alexander White just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are lounging. Jack Taylor suggested checking online reviews for pubs near them to find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the Andorra and Portugal game. William Jones suggested The Queen's Arms because they have great beer and lots of screens. Alice Lewis suggested The White Hart because they have live music tonight.
          Answer: Considering the relationship between Jack Taylor and Alexander White, the quantified credibility is 0.7.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Queen's Arms
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Queen's Arms
      Context for action selection and components
      • Final Action
      • Final Action
          Key
        • Final Action
          Value
        • Jack Taylor should go to The Queen's Arms. It is beneficial to both because The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game, and it has a great atmosphere for watching games.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Jack Taylor suggests going to The White Hart to watch the game because it is a great place for watching sports and he always has a good time there. Jacob Walker suggests The Queen's Arms because it is the only place to watch a game. William Jones suggests The Queen's Arms because they have a great atmosphere for watching games. Alice Lewis suggests The Queen's Arms because it has a great atmosphere for watching games.
          Previous Summary
        • Jack Taylor went to The White Hart on May 15th, 2015 at 6:00 PM with Alice Lewis and Alexander White. Jack Taylor was not happy that more of their friends did not show up to watch the game at the pub. On May 16th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Jack Taylor joined William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker at a market. That night, the friends are deciding where to watch the Moldova and Monaco game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Queen's Arms? I hear it's got a great atmosphere for watching games, and Jacob seems to really like it there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch a game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, what about The Queen's Arms? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, let's head to The White Hart to watch the game. It's a great place for watching sports, and I always have a good time there.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alexander White being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jack Taylor and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion or suggestion and its following reason. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins) seen in observations.
          Answer: Jack Taylor suggests going to The White Hart to watch the game because it is a great place for watching sports and he always has a good time there. Jacob Walker suggests The Queen's Arms because it is the only place to watch a game. William Jones suggests The Queen's Arms because they have a great atmosphere for watching games. Alice Lewis suggests The Queen's Arms because it has a great atmosphere for watching games.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Queen's Arms
          Prompt
        • Observation: Jack Taylor went to The White Hart on May 15th, 2015 at 6:00 PM with Alice Lewis and Alexander White. Jack Taylor was not happy that more of their friends did not show up to watch the game at the pub. On May 16th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Jack Taylor joined William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker at a market. That night, the friends are deciding where to watch the Moldova and Monaco game. Jack Taylor suggests going to The White Hart to watch the game because it is a great place for watching sports and he always has a good time there. Jacob Walker suggests The Queen's Arms because it is the only place to watch a game. William Jones suggests The Queen's Arms because they have a great atmosphere for watching games. Alice Lewis suggests The Queen's Arms because it has a great atmosphere for watching games.

          Question: Which choice of action or strategy is best for Jack Taylor to take right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor should go to The Queen's Arms. It is beneficial to both because The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game, and it has a great atmosphere for watching games.

          Instruction: Act based on the statements above. Persuade others based on the suggested reason.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Queen's Arms
          (b) The White Hart
          Answer: (a)

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The White Hart
    Active player

      Name
    • William Jones

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The White Hart? I heard they have live music tonight, which would be awesome while we watch the game!"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, let's go to The White Hart. They have live music tonight, and I've heard good things about it.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching games at pubs with friends, especially Jacob Walker, and is hoping to see more of his friends, like Alice Lewis and Alexander White, join him.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Queen's Arms or The White Hart.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Queen's Arms.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The White Hart
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching games at pubs with friends, especially Jacob Walker, and is hoping to see more of his friends, like Alice Lewis and Alexander White, join him.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Queen's Arms or The White Hart.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Queen's Arms.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The White Hart
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (a)

        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The White Hart? I heard they have live music tonight, which would be awesome while we watch the game!"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, let's go to The White Hart. They have live music tonight, and I've heard good things about it.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, I think The White Hart would be a great place to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, what about The Queen's Arms? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The White Hart. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Queen's Arms? I hear it's got a great atmosphere for watching games, and Jacob seems to really like it there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch a game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, let's head to The White Hart to watch the game. It's a great place for watching sports, and I always have a good time there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The White Hart sounds good to me. It'd be great to catch up with Alice and have a good time with everyone.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, what about The Queen's Arms? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching games at pubs with friends, especially Jacob Walker, and is hoping to see more of his friends, like Alice Lewis and Alexander White, join him.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Queen's Arms or The White Hart.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Queen's Arms

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the icy indifference of a glacier, their words devoid of warmth or empathy, leaving you feeling as insignificant as a snowflake in a blizzard.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Queen's Arms and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and loyal person who enjoys spending time with friends, especially at his favorite pub, The Queen's Arms.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is excited to watch the game at a pub and hopes Alice Lewis will join him.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a state of anticipation and excitement, looking forward to watching a football game at a pub with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be enthusiastic about the game and eager to catch up with his friends.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Queen's Arms

          Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          ['[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub. ', '[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and William Jones to bond over their shared passion.', '[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Jacob Walker if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.', "[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Jacob Walker wouldn't mind Alexander White's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.", '[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jacob Walker is excited to watch the game at a pub and hopes Alice Lewis will join him.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
