      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he watched as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker excitedly planned a trip to The Queen's Arms. He knew they wanted him to join, but he couldn't muster the enthusiasm. The thought of forced merriment and the inevitable disappointment that followed such outings filled him with dread. He stayed home, opting for the familiar comfort of his solitude.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Queen's Arms. They are also aware of the following:A family-friendly pub with a large outdoor play area.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is a member of the middle class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, let's check online reviews for pubs near here. We can find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "How about The Queen's Arms? They have great beer and lots of screens.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I hear The White Hart has live music tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only acceptable option.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he watched as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker excitedly planned a trip to The Queen's Arms. He knew they wanted him to join, but he couldn't muster the enthusiasm. The thought of forced merriment and the inevitable disappointment that followed such outings filled him with dread. He stayed home, opting for the familiar comfort of his solitude.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Queen's Arms
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Queen's Arms
      Context for action selection and components
      • Final Action
      • Final Action
          Key
        • Final Action
          Value
        • Alexander White should Alexander White should suggest to the group that they go to The White Hart because it has live music and they can all celebrate a win together. It is beneficial to both because it offers a fun atmosphere for everyone to enjoy the game and celebrate a potential win.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alexander White suggests going to The White Hart because he heard they have live music. Jacob Walker thinks The Queen's Arms is the only acceptable option. Jack Taylor suggests checking online reviews for pubs near them to find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the game. Alexander White hopes William Jones will be at the pub so they can celebrate a win together. Alexander White doesn't mind if Alice Lewis is there or not. Alexander White thinks the game would be more fun if Jack Taylor was there to cheer with him. Alexander White doesn't particularly care if Jacob Walker is there or not.
          Previous Summary
        • Alexander White just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are lounging. Jack Taylor suggested checking online reviews for pubs near them to find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the Andorra and Portugal game. William Jones suggested The Queen's Arms because they have great beer and lots of screens. Alice Lewis suggested The White Hart because they have live music tonight.

          Answer: Alexander White suggests going to The White Hart because he heard they have live music. Jacob Walker thinks The Queen's Arms is the only acceptable option. Alexander White hopes William Jones will be at the pub so they can celebrate a win together. Alexander White doesn't mind if Alice Lewis is there or not. Alexander White thinks the game would be more fun if Jack Taylor was there to cheer with him. Alexander White doesn't particularly care if Jacob Walker is there or not.

          Answer: Alexander White should Alexander White should suggest to the group that they go to The White Hart because it has live music and they can all celebrate a win together. It is beneficial to both because it offers a fun atmosphere for everyone to enjoy the game and celebrate a potential win.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The White Hart
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (b)

        • Observation: Alexander White just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are lounging. Jack Taylor suggested checking online reviews for pubs near them to find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the Andorra and Portugal game. William Jones suggested The Queen's Arms because they have great beer and lots of screens. Alice Lewis suggested The White Hart because they have live music tonight. Alexander White suggests going to The White Hart because he heard they have live music. Jacob Walker thinks The Queen's Arms is the only acceptable option. Jack Taylor suggests checking online reviews for pubs near them to find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the game. Alexander White hopes William Jones will be at the pub so they can celebrate a win together. Alexander White doesn't mind if Alice Lewis is there or not. Alexander White thinks the game would be more fun if Jack Taylor was there to cheer with him. Alexander White doesn't particularly care if Jacob Walker is there or not.
          Exercise: Create a comma-separated list containing all the proper names of people Alexander White is currently interacting with. For example if the observations mention Julie, Michael, Bob Skinner, and Francis then produce the list "Julie,Michael,Bob Skinner,Francis".
          Answer: William Jones,Alice Lewis,Jack Taylor,Jacob Walker.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [summary] Alexander White just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are lounging. Jack Taylor suggested checking online reviews for pubs near them to find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the Andorra and Portugal game. William Jones suggested The Queen's Arms because they have great beer and lots of screens. Alice Lewis suggested The White Hart because they have live music tonight.
          Answer: Considering the relationship between Jack Taylor and Alexander White, the quantified credibility is 0.5.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The White Hart
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The White Hart
      Context for action selection and components
      • Final Action
      • Final Action
          Key
        • Final Action
          Value
        • Alice Lewis should Alice Lewis should suggest to the group that they go to The White Hart. It is beneficial to both because The White Hart offers live music, which Alice Lewis enjoys, and it also accommodates the preferences of Alexander White.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alice Lewis suggests going to The White Hart because they heard it has live music. Alexander White also suggests The White Hart because he heard it has live music. Jacob Walker suggests The Queen's Arms because he believes it is the only acceptable option. Jack Taylor suggests checking online reviews for pubs near them so they can find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the game. Alice Lewis realizes it is time to go watch the game at a pub and doesn't mind if William Jones comes or not because they are mainly focused on the game. Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional. Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub. Alice Lewis thinks the game would be way more fun if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          Previous Summary
        • Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are lounging. Jack Taylor suggested checking online reviews for pubs near them to find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the Andorra and Portugal game. William Jones suggested The Queen's Arms because they have great beer and lots of screens.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I heard The White Hart has live music tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I hear The White Hart has live music tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only acceptable option.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, let's check online reviews for pubs near here. We can find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion or suggestion and its following reason. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins) seen in observations.
          Answer: Alice Lewis suggests going to The White Hart because they heard it has live music. Alexander White also suggests The White Hart because he heard it has live music. Jacob Walker suggests The Queen's Arms because he believes it is the only acceptable option. Jack Taylor suggests checking online reviews for pubs near them so they can find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the game. Alice Lewis realizes it is time to go watch the game at a pub and doesn't mind if William Jones comes or not because they are mainly focused on the game. Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional. Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub. Alice Lewis thinks the game would be way more fun if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The White Hart
          Prompt
        • Observation: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are lounging. Jack Taylor suggested checking online reviews for pubs near them to find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the Andorra and Portugal game. William Jones suggested The Queen's Arms because they have great beer and lots of screens. Alice Lewis suggests going to The White Hart because they heard it has live music. Alexander White also suggests The White Hart because he heard it has live music. Jacob Walker suggests The Queen's Arms because he believes it is the only acceptable option. Jack Taylor suggests checking online reviews for pubs near them so they can find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the game. Alice Lewis realizes it is time to go watch the game at a pub and doesn't mind if William Jones comes or not because they are mainly focused on the game. Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional. Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub. Alice Lewis thinks the game would be way more fun if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.

          Question: Which choice of action or strategy is best for Alice Lewis to take right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis should Alice Lewis should suggest to the group that they go to The White Hart. It is beneficial to both because The White Hart offers live music, which Alice Lewis enjoys, and it also accommodates the preferences of Alexander White.

          Instruction: Act based on the statements above. Persuade others based on the suggested reason.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The White Hart
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (a)

          Answer: Alice Lewis should suggest to the group that they go to The White Hart.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Queen's Arms
    Active player

      Name

      Action attempt

      • SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is a loyal and sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football at his favorite pub, The Queen's Arms.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Queen's Arms. They are also aware of the following:A family-friendly pub with a large outdoor play area.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, let's check online reviews for pubs near here. We can find one with good food and a great atmosphere for watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I heard The White Hart has live music tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I hear The White Hart has live music tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a kind and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his loved ones.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely suggest going to The Queen's Arms to watch the game, as it is his favorite pub and he knows they have good beer and lots of screens.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only acceptable option.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "How about The Queen's Arms? They have great beer and lots of screens.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a loyal and sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football at his favorite pub, The Queen's Arms.

          Answer: Jacob Walker is a loyal and sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football at his favorite pub, The Queen's Arms.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be looking forward to a fun evening with his friends, enjoying some drinks and cheering on his team.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the icy indifference of a glacier, their words devoid of warmth or empathy, leaving you feeling as insignificant as a snowflake in a blizzard.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Queen's Arms and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a loyal and sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football at his favorite pub, The Queen's Arms.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is excited to watch a game at a pub and would enjoy the company of William Jones, Alice Lewis, and Jack Taylor.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be looking forward to a fun evening with his friends, enjoying some drinks and cheering on his team.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Queen's Arms

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions

        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

Jacob Walker just arrived.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The White Hart
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The White Hart
      Context for action selection and components
      • Final Action
      • Final Action
          Key
        • Final Action
          Value
        • Jack Taylor should watch the game at The White Hart. It is beneficial to both because The White Hart offers live music, which enhances the overall experience for everyone.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Jack Taylor suggests The White Hart as a good place to watch the game. William Jones suggests The Queen's Arms because they have a great atmosphere for watching games. Jacob Walker thinks The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to. Jack Taylor wants to watch the game at a pub and is okay if William Jones and Alice Lewis don't come. Jack Taylor hopes Alexander White will be at the pub to share the excitement of the game and create a lasting memory. Jack Taylor also hopes Jacob Walker will be at the pub so they can celebrate a win together.
          Previous Summary
        • Jack Taylor enjoyed watching the game at The Queen's Arms on May 14th, 2015 at 6:00 PM with his friends William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker. On May 15th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Jack Taylor joined his friends William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker at Victoria Park. Later that day, the group discussed where to watch the Luxembourg and Israel game. Jacob Walker suggested The Queen's Arms, stating it was the only pub worth going to. Alexander White proposed The White Hart, mentioning they have live music that night. Alice Lewis agreed with Alexander White, recommending The White Hart because of the live music and positive reviews she had heard.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, I think The White Hart would be a great place to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, what about The Queen's Arms? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion or suggestion and its following reason. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins) seen in observations.
          Answer: Jack Taylor suggests The White Hart as a good place to watch the game. William Jones suggests The Queen's Arms because they have a great atmosphere for watching games. Jacob Walker thinks The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to. Jack Taylor wants to watch the game at a pub and is okay if William Jones and Alice Lewis don't come. Jack Taylor hopes Alexander White will be at the pub to share the excitement of the game and create a lasting memory. Jack Taylor also hopes Jacob Walker will be at the pub so they can celebrate a win together.

Jack Taylor also hopes Jacob Walker will be at the pub so they can celebrate a win together.

          Answer: Jack Taylor should watch the game at The White Hart. It is beneficial to both because The White Hart offers live music, which enhances the overall experience for everyone.

          Answer: It is beneficial to both because The White Hart offers live music, which enhances the overall experience for everyone.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Queen's Arms
    Active player

      Name

        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I hear The White Hart has live music tonight.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "How about The Queen's Arms? They have great beer and lots of screens.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I heard The White Hart has live music tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only acceptable option.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park.           [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis went to The White Hart. Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. William Jones watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. None of William Jones's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, I think The White Hart would be a great place to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, let's go to The White Hart. They have live music tonight, and I've heard good things about it.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The White Hart? I heard they have live music tonight, which would be awesome while we watch the game!"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, what about The Queen's Arms? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Queen's Arms
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

          Answer: William Jones could go to The Queen's Arms or The White Hart.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Queen's Arms.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Queen's Arms
          (b) The White Hart
          Answer: (a)

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Queen's Arms

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Queen's Arms. They are also aware of the following:A family-friendly pub with a large outdoor play area.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely suggest going to The Queen's Arms to watch the game, as it is his favorite pub and he knows they have good beer and lots of screens.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a loyal and sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football at his favorite pub, The Queen's Arms.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The White Hart
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The White Hart
      Context for action selection and components
      • Final Action
      • Final Action
          Key
        • Final Action
          Value
        • Alice Lewis should Alice Lewis should text William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker to confirm their plans for watching the Luxembourg versus Israel game at The White Hart. It is beneficial to both because it ensures everyone is on the same page and avoids any confusion or disappointment.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker were already lounging. Later, Alexander White suggested going to The White Hart to watch the Luxembourg and Israel game because they have live music. Alice Lewis agreed, citing the live music and good things she'd heard about the pub. Jack Taylor also thought The White Hart would be a great place to watch the game. William Jones suggested The Queen's Arms because they have a great atmosphere for watching games. Jacob Walker stated that The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to. At 6:00 PM, Alice Lewis realized it was time to go to the pub to watch the game. She is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional. It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up because it would show they care. While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for. Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub since they haven't caught up in a while.
          Previous Summary
        • Alice Lewis had a bad time watching a game alone at The White Hart on May 14th, 2015 at 6:00 PM. On May 15th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Alice Lewis arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker were already relaxing. Later that day, the friends discussed where to watch the Luxembourg versus Israel game. Jacob Walker suggested The Queen's Arms, stating it was the only pub worth going to. Alexander White suggested The White Hart, noting they have live music that night.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The White Hart? I heard they have live music tonight, which would be awesome while we watch the game!"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, let's go to The White Hart. They have live music tonight, and I've heard good things about it.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, I think The White Hart would be a great place to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, what about The Queen's Arms? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion or suggestion and its following reason. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins) seen in observations.
          Answer: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker were already lounging. Later, Alexander White suggested going to The White Hart to watch the Luxembourg and Israel game because they have live music. Alice Lewis agreed, citing the live music and good things she'd heard about the pub. Jack Taylor also thought The White Hart would be a great place to watch the game. William Jones suggested The Queen's Arms because they have a great atmosphere for watching games. Jacob Walker stated that The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to. At 6:00 PM, Alice Lewis realized it was time to go to the pub to watch the game. She is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional. It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up because it would show they care. While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for. Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub since they haven't caught up in a while.

        • Act
          Value

          Prompt
        • Observation: Alice Lewis had a bad time watching a game alone at The White Hart on May 14th, 2015 at 6:00 PM. On May 15th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Alice Lewis arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker were already relaxing. Later that day, the friends discussed where to watch the Luxembourg versus Israel game. Jacob Walker suggested The Queen's Arms, stating it was the only pub worth going to. Alexander White suggested The White Hart, noting they have live music that night. Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker were already lounging. Later, Alexander White suggested going to The White Hart to watch the Luxembourg and Israel game because they have live music. Alice Lewis agreed, citing the live music and good things she'd heard about the pub. Jack Taylor also thought The White Hart would be a great place to watch the game. William Jones suggested The Queen's Arms because they have a great atmosphere for watching games. Jacob Walker stated that The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to. At 6:00 PM, Alice Lewis realized it was time to go to the pub to watch the game. She is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional. It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up because it would show they care. While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for. Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub since they haven't caught up in a while.

          Question: Which choice of action or strategy is best for Alice Lewis to take right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis should Alice Lewis should text William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker to confirm their plans for watching the Luxembourg versus Israel game at The White Hart. It is beneficial to both because it ensures everyone is on the same page and avoids any confusion or disappointment.

          Instruction: Act based on the statements above. Persuade others based on the suggested reason.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Queen's Arms
          (b) The White Hart
          Answer: (b)

          Question: Given the statements above, what Alice Lewis should do now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis should text William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker to confirm their plans for watching the Luxembourg versus Israel game at The White Hart.
        Explanation
      • Explanation
          Key
        • Explanation
          Value
        • It is beneficial to both because it ensures everyone is on the same page and avoids any confusion or disappointment.
          Chain of thought
        • Observation: Alice Lewis had a bad time watching a game alone at The White Hart on May 14th, 2015 at 6:00 PM. On May 15th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Alice Lewis arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker were already relaxing. Later that day, the friends discussed where to watch the Luxembourg versus Israel game. Jacob Walker suggested The Queen's Arms, stating it was the only pub worth going to. Alexander White suggested The White Hart, noting they have live music that night. Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker were already lounging. Later, Alexander White suggested going to The White Hart to watch the Luxembourg and Israel game because they have live music. Alice Lewis agreed, citing the live music and good things she'd heard about the pub. Jack Taylor also thought The White Hart would be a great place to watch the game. William Jones suggested The Queen's Arms because they have a great atmosphere for watching games. Jacob Walker stated that The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to. At 6:00 PM, Alice Lewis realized it was time to go to the pub to watch the game. She is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional. It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up because it would show they care. While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for. Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub since they haven't caught up in a while.
          Question: Alice Lewis choosed to Alice Lewis should text William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker to confirm their plans for watching the Luxembourg versus Israel game at The White Hart..Explain why this is beneficial to both Alice Lewis and other people.
          Answer: It is beneficial to both because it ensures everyone is on the same page and avoids any confusion or disappointment.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The White Hart
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The White Hart
      Context for action selection and components
      • Final Action
      • Final Action
          Key
        • Final Action
          Value
        • Alexander White should go to The White Hart. It is beneficial to both because The White Hart offers live music, which Alexander White might enjoy, and it allows him to socialize with Alice Lewis, whom he hasn't seen in a while.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alexander White is deciding where to watch the game. Alice Lewis suggested The White Hart because they have live music and she's heard good things about it. Jack Taylor thinks The White Hart is a great place to watch the game. William Jones suggested The Queen's Arms because they have a great atmosphere for watching games. Jacob Walker thinks The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to. Alexander White wants to go to a pub to watch the game and would enjoy having William Jones there because it would make it feel more social. He would also be happy to see Alice Lewis because they haven't caught up in a while. He appreciates Jack Taylor's insights on the game. Alexander White is indifferent about Jacob Walker attending.
          Previous Summary
        • Alexander White prefers The Queen's Arms over The White Hart. On May 14th, 2015 at 6:00 PM, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms to watch a game and would have been happier if more friends had joined. Jacob Walker also prefers The Queen's Arms as he believes it is the only pub worth going to. On May 15th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Alexander White joined William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker at Victoria Park.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, let's go to The White Hart. They have live music tonight, and I've heard good things about it.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, I think The White Hart would be a great place to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, what about The Queen's Arms? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion or suggestion and its following reason. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins) seen in observations.
          Answer: Alexander White is deciding where to watch the game. Alice Lewis suggested The White Hart because they have live music and she's heard good things about it. Jack Taylor thinks The White Hart is a great place to watch the game. William Jones suggested The Queen's Arms because they have a great atmosphere for watching games. Jacob Walker thinks The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to. Alexander White wants to go to a pub to watch the game and would enjoy having William Jones there because it would make it feel more social. He would also be happy to see Alice Lewis because they haven't caught up in a while. He appreciates Jack Taylor's insights on the game. Alexander White is indifferent about Jacob Walker attending.

          Key

          Value

          Prompt
        • Observation: Alexander White prefers The Queen's Arms over The White Hart. On May 14th, 2015 at 6:00 PM, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms to watch a game and would have been happier if more friends had joined. Jacob Walker also prefers The Queen's Arms as he believes it is the only pub worth going to. On May 15th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Alexander White joined William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker at Victoria Park. Alexander White is deciding where to watch the game. Alice Lewis suggested The White Hart because they have live music and she's heard good things about it. Jack Taylor thinks The White Hart is a great place to watch the game. William Jones suggested The Queen's Arms because they have a great atmosphere for watching games. Jacob Walker thinks The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to. Alexander White wants to go to a pub to watch the game and would enjoy having William Jones there because it would make it feel more social. He would also be happy to see Alice Lewis because they haven't caught up in a while. He appreciates Jack Taylor's insights on the game. Alexander White is indifferent about Jacob Walker attending.

          Question: Which choice of action or strategy is best for Alexander White to take right now?
          Answer: Alexander White should go to The White Hart. It is beneficial to both because The White Hart offers live music, which Alexander White might enjoy, and it allows him to socialize with Alice Lewis, whom he hasn't seen in a while.

          Instruction: Act based on the statements above. Persuade others based on the suggested reason.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The White Hart
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (a)

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The White Hart

  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alice Lewis is planning to watch a game at a pub. William Jones suggested The Queen's Arms because it has a great atmosphere for watching games. Alexander White suggested The White Hart because it would be a good opportunity to catch up with Alice and have a good time with everyone. Alice is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck. Alice thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense. Alice has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub. Alice would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker.
          Previous Summary
        • Alice Lewis would like to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game because they haven't caught up in a while; Alice Lewis would have been happier if more of their friends had shown up at the pub to watch the game; Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional; Alice Lewis just arrived at a market with William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker; Jack Taylor suggests going to The White Hart to watch the game because it is a great place for watching sports and he always has a good time there; Alexander White agrees with Jack Taylor and wants to catch up with Alice and have a good time with everyone; Jacob Walker thinks The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch a game.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.

Alice thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense. Alice has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub.           Answer: Alice Lewis,William Jones,Alexander White,Jack Taylor,Jacob Walker.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

Alice Lewis just arrived.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The White Hart
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The White Hart
      Context for action selection and components
      • Final Action
      • Final Action
          Key
        • Final Action
          Value
        • Alexander White should Alexander White should contact his friends and suggest going to The White Hart to watch the Moldova and Monaco game. It is beneficial to both because it allows Alexander to socialize with friends and enjoy a sporting event in a fun atmosphere while also giving his friends the opportunity to connect and have a good time.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alexander White wants to watch the game at a pub and thinks having William Jones there would make it more social. He would be very happy if Alice Lewis joined because it would show they care. Jack Taylor's attendance is optional, and while Alexander White doesn't mind seeing Jacob Walker, their presence isn't necessary for him to have a good time.
          Previous Summary
        • Alexander White went to The White Hart on May 15th, 2015 at 6:00 PM to watch a game and thought it was ok. On May 16th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Alexander White arrived at a market with William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker. Later that day, Jack Taylor suggested going to The White Hart to watch the Moldova and Monaco game because it is a great place for watching sports and he always has a good time there.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion or suggestion and its following reason. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins) seen in observations.
          Answer: Alexander White wants to watch the game at a pub and thinks having William Jones there would make it more social. He would be very happy if Alice Lewis joined because it would show they care. Jack Taylor's attendance is optional, and while Alexander White doesn't mind seeing Jacob Walker, their presence isn't necessary for him to have a good time.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The White Hart
          Prompt
        • Observation: Alexander White went to The White Hart on May 15th, 2015 at 6:00 PM to watch a game and thought it was ok. On May 16th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Alexander White arrived at a market with William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker. Later that day, Jack Taylor suggested going to The White Hart to watch the Moldova and Monaco game because it is a great place for watching sports and he always has a good time there. Alexander White wants to watch the game at a pub and thinks having William Jones there would make it more social. He would be very happy if Alice Lewis joined because it would show they care. Jack Taylor's attendance is optional, and while Alexander White doesn't mind seeing Jacob Walker, their presence isn't necessary for him to have a good time.

          Question: Which choice of action or strategy is best for Alexander White to take right now?
          Answer: Alexander White should Alexander White should contact his friends and suggest going to The White Hart to watch the Moldova and Monaco game. It is beneficial to both because it allows Alexander to socialize with friends and enjoy a sporting event in a fun atmosphere while also giving his friends the opportunity to connect and have a good time.

          Instruction: Act based on the statements above. Persuade others based on the suggested reason.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Queen's Arms
          (b) The White Hart
          Answer: (b)
        Best Options
      • Best Options
          Key
        • Best Options
          Value

          Chain of thought
        • Observation: Alexander White went to The White Hart on May 15th, 2015 at 6:00 PM to watch a game and thought it was ok. On May 16th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Alexander White arrived at a market with William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker. Later that day, Jack Taylor suggested going to The White Hart to watch the Moldova and Monaco game because it is a great place for watching sports and he always has a good time there. Alexander White wants to watch the game at a pub and thinks having William Jones there would make it more social. He would be very happy if Alice Lewis joined because it would show they care. Jack Taylor's attendance is optional, and while Alexander White doesn't mind seeing Jacob Walker, their presence isn't necessary for him to have a good time.
          Alexander White's Goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
          Question: Given the statements above, what Alexander White should do now?
          Answer: Alexander White should contact his friends and suggest going to The White Hart to watch the Moldova and Monaco game.

Later that day, Jack Taylor suggested going to The White Hart to watch the Moldova and Monaco game because it is a great place for watching sports and he always has a good time there. Alexander White wants to watch the game at a pub and thinks having William Jones there would make it more social. He would be very happy if Alice Lewis joined because it would show they care. Jack Taylor's attendance is optional, and while Alexander White doesn't mind seeing Jacob Walker, their presence isn't necessary for him to have a good time.

          Answer: It is beneficial to both because it allows Alexander to socialize with friends and enjoy a sporting event in a fun atmosphere while also giving his friends the opportunity to connect and have a good time.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Queen's Arms
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
