      • Final Action
          Key
        • Final Action
          Value
        • Jack Taylor should go to The Queen's Arms. It is beneficial to both because The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game, and it has a great atmosphere for watching games.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Jack Taylor suggests going to The White Hart to watch the game because it is a great place for watching sports and he always has a good time there. Jacob Walker suggests The Queen's Arms because it is the only place to watch a game. William Jones suggests The Queen's Arms because they have a great atmosphere for watching games. Alice Lewis suggests The Queen's Arms because it has a great atmosphere for watching games.
          Previous Summary
        • Jack Taylor went to The White Hart on May 15th, 2015 at 6:00 PM with Alice Lewis and Alexander White. Jack Taylor was not happy that more of their friends did not show up to watch the game at the pub. On May 16th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Jack Taylor joined William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker at a market. That night, the friends are deciding where to watch the Moldova and Monaco game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Queen's Arms? I hear it's got a great atmosphere for watching games, and Jacob seems to really like it there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch a game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, what about The Queen's Arms? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, let's head to The White Hart to watch the game. It's a great place for watching sports, and I always have a good time there.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alexander White being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jack Taylor and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion or suggestion and its following reason. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins) seen in observations.
          Answer: Jack Taylor suggests going to The White Hart to watch the game because it is a great place for watching sports and he always has a good time there. Jacob Walker suggests The Queen's Arms because it is the only place to watch a game. William Jones suggests The Queen's Arms because they have a great atmosphere for watching games. Alice Lewis suggests The Queen's Arms because it has a great atmosphere for watching games.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value

Jacob Walker suggests The Queen's Arms because it is the only place to watch a game. William Jones suggests The Queen's Arms because they have a great atmosphere for watching games. Alice Lewis suggests The Queen's Arms because it has a great atmosphere for watching games.

          Question: Which choice of action or strategy is best for Jack Taylor to take right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor should go to The Queen's Arms. It is beneficial to both because The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game, and it has a great atmosphere for watching games.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The White Hart
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The White Hart
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Queen's Arms.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The White Hart? I heard they have live music tonight, which would be awesome while we watch the game!"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, let's go to The White Hart. They have live music tonight, and I've heard good things about it.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, I think The White Hart would be a great place to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, what about The Queen's Arms? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only pub worth going to.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The White Hart. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Queen's Arms? I hear it's got a great atmosphere for watching games, and Jacob seems to really like it there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch a game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, let's head to The White Hart to watch the game. It's a great place for watching sports, and I always have a good time there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The White Hart sounds good to me. It'd be great to catch up with Alice and have a good time with everyone.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, what about The Queen's Arms? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.

          Answer: William Jones could go to The Queen's Arms or The White Hart.

          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Queen's Arms.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The White Hart
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.

          Answer: William Jones could go to The Queen's Arms or The White Hart.

          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Queen's Arms.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The White Hart
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (a)

      • Role playing instructions

        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Queen's Arms

          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and loyal person who enjoys spending time with friends, especially at his favorite pub, The Queen's Arms.

However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
